sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"绝望，沮丧"之意。
means: despair ： 普通用词，指因灾难等因素而丧失希望和信心，陷入沮丧，绝望的境地。
desperation ： 语气强烈，指因绝望而使人采取无所顾忌的疯狂行动。
depression ： 侧重指因遭受重大失利或挫折而产生的低落情绪。
disappointment ： 多指愿望或期望的落空。

sentence.Network_en: If there was any disappointment it was probably temporary.
sentence.Network_cn: 即便有点儿失望，也肯定是暂时的。

sentence.Network_en: The city proved to be something of a disappointment.
sentence.Network_cn: 结果这座城市有点儿令人失望。

sentence.Network_en: For many, their long-awaited homecoming was a bitter disappointment.
sentence.Network_cn: 对许多人来说，他们期盼已久的还乡之行却令他们大失所望。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语常见词根前缀后缀大全 ... government 政府 disappointment 失望 eagerness 渴望.
人教版高中英语单词表(第三册上必修) - 豆丁网 ... counter n. 柜台 disappointment n. 失望；沮丧 indeed ad. 确实；实在.
2005考研词汇—lesson... ... disappoint v. 使失望,使扫兴 disappointment n. 失望，令人失望的人或事；挫折 disaster n. 灾难,天灾.
老电影-目录大全 ... 死去活来 HALF DEAD，HALF ALIVE 失恋者 DISAPPOINTMENT 金镖黄天霸 GOLDEN DART HERO.

list.abs: greatly是什么意思_百度知道 ... adv. 很，大大地；非常 greatly disappointed 大失所望；大失所看 Greatly Inspired 深受鼓舞.
...部分bug，只剩下一些小bug，他对社区的决定表示非常失望（very disappointed）。
bitter什么意思？_百度知道 ... bitter end 最后；结局 bitterly disappointed 透心凉；彻底的失望 bitter about 痛苦于.
新概念英语第二册学习笔记（2） ... chilly： 寒冷的 bitterly disappointed： 彻底的失望 a drop of： 一缕.
大学英语四级词汇短语总归纳-自考-搜狐博客 ... clumsy at 做…很笨拙 disappointed at 对…失望 excellent at 极其擅长于.

entry.def: Disappointment is the state of feeling disappointed.

example.ex: Despite winning the title, their last campaign ended in great disappointment...
example.tran: 尽管赢得了冠军，但他们最后一役却令人大失所望。

entry.def: Something or someone that is a disappointment is not as good as you had hoped.

example.ex: For many, their long-awaited homecoming was a bitter disappointment.
example.tran: 对许多人来说，他们期盼已久的还乡之行却令他们大失所望。

example.ex: ...this ne'er-do-well brother who was such a disappointment to his family.
example.tran: 这个令他家人如此失望的没出息的兄弟

means.word_mean: 1. a feeling of dissatisfaction that results when your expectations are not realized;

sentences.sentence: "his hopes were so high he was doomed to disappointment"

means.word_mean: 2. an act (or failure to act) that disappoints someone

auth_sentence.content: Labour expressed its disappointment at the Government's stance.
auth_sentence.res_content: Labour expressed its disappointment at the Government's stance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Labour expressed its disappointment at the Government's stance.

auth_sentence.content: Her tone is one of disappointment more than anger.
auth_sentence.res_content: Her tone is one of disappointment more than anger.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her tone is one of disappointment more than anger.

auth_sentence.content: We took a drive of disappointment through East Hampton.
auth_sentence.res_content: We took a drive of disappointment through East Hampton.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We took a drive of disappointment through East Hampton.

Sentence.sentence: Although the negative emotions associated with romantic love — fear of loss, disappointment and jealousy — are fairly consistent across cultures, the positive feelings can vary.

sentences.en: She experienced a sharp pang of disappointment.
sentences.cn: 她经历了失望的巨大痛苦。

means.word_mean: 使人失望的人（或事物）；令人扫兴的人（或事物）

sentences.en: These children are prepared for the disappointments as well as the joys of life.
sentences.cn: 这些孩子不仅准备享受生活的乐趣, 而且也准备经受生活中的失意。

sentences.en: I went to his talk with great interest, but to my disappointment, nothing very new came forth.
sentences.cn: 我抱着极大的兴趣去听他的讲话,但令我失望的是讲话中没有什么新东西。
